00026 Implemente_base_sans_constructeur(Precond_base,"Precond_base",Objet_U);
00027 
00028 Precond_base::Precond_base()
00029 {
00030   status_ = REINIT_ALL;
00031   echange_ev_solution_ = 1;
00032 }
00033

00044 //
00045 //
00046 //! this method must be called before preconditionner() whenever<br>the matrix changes (coefficients only or coefficients and structure) to<br>tell the object to recompute some matrix related data.
00047 void Precond_base::reinit(Init_Status x)
00048 {
00049   switch(x)
00050     {
00051     case READY:
00052       break;
00053     case REINIT_COEFF:
00054       if (status_ != REINIT_ALL) status_ = REINIT_COEFF;
00055       break;
00056     case REINIT_ALL:
00057       status_ = REINIT_ALL;
00058       break;
00059     default:
00060       Cerr << "Error Precond_base::reinit" << finl;
00061       exit();
00062     }
00063 }
00064 
00065 //
00066 //! returns 1 if the implementation accepts Matrice_Morse_Sym matrices,  otherwise 0.<br>(must be reimplemented if answer is 0)
00067 int Precond_base::supporte_matrice_morse_sym()
00068 {
00069   return 1;
00070 }

00074 
00075 //
00076 //
00077 //! Call this method to change the behaviour of the preconditionner() method<br>0-> result will not have an up-to-date virtual space<br>1-> yes it will (this must be the default value in the implementation)
00078 void Precond_base::set_echange_espace_virtuel_resultat(int flag)
00079 {
00080   echange_ev_solution_ = flag;
00081 }
00082 
00083 //
00084 //
00085 //! Call to the prepare() method if reinit() has been called previously, then<br>call to preconditionner_()...<br>If echange_ev_solution is not zero, the solution vector will have an updated virtual space.
00086 int Precond_base::preconditionner(const Matrice_Base& m, const DoubleVect& src, DoubleVect& solution)
00087 {
00088   if (status_ != READY)
00089     prepare(m, src);
00090 // implementation of the prepare() method must call ancestor methods until Precond_base::prepare();
00091   assert(status_ == READY);
00092   int ok = preconditionner_(m, src, solution);
00093   return ok;
00094 }
00095 
00096 //
00097 //
00098 //
00099 //! prepares the preconditionner if needed after a matrix change (reinit() call).<br>prepare() is public, in case we want to perform preparation separately from preconditionning (eg nested solvers)<br>but calling prepare() is not mandatory (done automatically in preconditionner())<br>m is the new matrix, and md is the descriptor of the solution vector.
00100 void Precond_base::prepare(const Matrice_Base& m, const DoubleVect& v)
00101 {
00102   if (status_ != READY)
00103     prepare_(m, v);
00104   assert(status_ == READY);
00105 }
00106 
00107 //
00108 //
00109 //
00110 //! this method must be overloaded if some preparation is necessary.<br>It is called after a call to reinit() and before the next call to preconditionner_().<br>Do not forget to call the prepare_() method of the ancestor (at the end of the routine, otherwise<br>status will be put to READY) and use get_status() to know what should be prepared.
00111 void Precond_base::prepare_(const Matrice_Base& m, const DoubleVect& v)
00112 {
00113   status_ = READY;
00114 }
